---
title: "Income in NY"
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(tidycensus)
```

```{r}
# Get household income data by census tract in New York

ny_income <- get_acs(

  geography = "tract",

  variables = "B19013_001", # Median household income in the past 12 months

  state = "NY",

  year = 2020,

  geometry = TRUE

)

 

# Rename the variable for better readability

ny_income <- ny_income %>%

  rename(median_income = estimate)

 

# Plot the data

ggplot(data = ny_income) +

  geom_sf(aes(fill = median_income)) +

  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "viridis", na.value = "grey50", name = "Median Income") +

  labs(title = "Median Household Income by Census Tract in New York",

       subtitle = "Source: U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 ACS 5-Year Estimates",

       caption = "Data retrieved using tidycensus") +

  theme_minimal()
```
